001package gust.backend.transport;
002
003import io.micronaut.aop.MethodInterceptor;
004
005import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
006import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
007
008
009/**
010 * Defines the interface by which "transport manager" objects must comply. These objects are used to construct and
011 * manage connections to other machines or systems, usually via higher-order service layers like gRPC.
012 *
013 * @param <A> Annotation qualifier type, which is responsible for marking types that need injection from a given
014 *           implementing manager.
015 * @param <E> Enumerated connection type, or service type. An instance of this enumerated type is required when
016 *           acquiring a connection.
017 * @param <C> Connection implementation. Should match the object that a given manager hands back when a connection is
018 *           acquired for use.
019 */
020public interface TransportManager<A extends Annotation, E extends Enum<E>, C> extends MethodInterceptor<Object, C> {
021  /** Config prefix under which transport settings are specified. */
022  String ROOT_CONFIG_PREFIX = "transport";
023
024  /**
025   * Acquire a connection from this transport manager. The connection provided may or may not be freshly-created,
026   * depending on the underlying implementation, but it should never be <pre>null</pre> (exceptions are raised instead).
027   *
028   * @param type Type of connection to acquire. Defined by the implementation.
029   * @return Connection instance.
030   * @throws TransportException If the connection could not be acquired.
031   */
032  @Nonnull C acquire(@Nonnull E type) throws TransportException;
033}
